bib.title: Modeling and optimization of survivable P2P multicasting
bib.author: Walkowiak, Krzysztof and Przewo{\'z}niczek, Micha{\l}
bib.abstract: Various solutions based on Peer-to-Peer (P2P) multicasting have been gaining much popularity in recent years, since P2P multicasting can effectively support live streaming of various content. In this work we assume that the P2P multicasting is used to distribute content with high reliability requirements, eg, weather warnings, security updates, financial data, security warnings, etc. The main idea to provide protection of the system against network failures is to establish several (at least two) disjoint multicasting trees.
